snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown signed a bill Tuesday outlawing so-called revenge porn. The penalty is up to six months in jail and a $1,000 fine.
abstract: Gov Jerry Brown of California signs bill outlawing so-called revenge porn, making it a misdemeanor to post identifiable nude pictures online without permission with intent to cause distress and humiliation.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown signed a bill Tuesday outlawing so-called revenge porn. The penalty is up to six months in jail and a $1,000 fine.
